intro: Sinowilsonia henryi, commonly known as the Chinese wilsonia, is a rare flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of China. It belongs to the family Ericaceae, which includes heathers and blueberries, and is characterized by its evergreen foliage and showy, bell-shaped flowers. The plant typically grows in acidic, well-drained soils and thrives in cool, moist environments. Its ornamental value lies in its compact growth habit and vibrant spring blooms. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a conservation concern.
